sen.j: 正倉（しょうそう）とは、律令制において中央・地方の官衙や寺院など公的な施設に設置された穀物や財物を保管する倉庫のこと。
sen.e: Shoso is an repository for grain and property, and is placed in the public facilities, such as central and regional kanga (government office) and temples in the ritsuryo system (a system of centralized government based on the ritsuryo code).

Shoso is an repository for grain and property, and is placed in the public facilities, such as central and regional kanga (government office) and temples in the ritsuryo system (a system of centralized government based on the ritsuryo code).

Shoso is an repository for grain and property, and is placed in the public facilities, such as central and regional kanga (government office) and temples in the ritsuryo system (a system of centralized government based on the ritsuryo code).

sen.j: 中央においては、大蔵省に租庸調を納める正倉があり、地方では当初各郡に正税を納める正倉があり、郡司により管理運用されていた。
sen.e: In the center, okura-sho (Ministry of the Treasury) had a shoso for soyocho (a tax system, corvee) and in the regions, at first, each gun (county) had shoso for shozei (the rice tax stored in provincial offices warehouse) administered by gunji (district managers).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: In the center, okura-sho (Ministry of the Treasury) had a shoso for soyocho (a tax system, corvee) and in the regions, at first, each gun (county) had shoso for shozei (the rice tax stored in provincial offices warehouse) administered by gunji (district managers).

In the center, okura-sho (Ministry of the Treasury) had a shoso for soyocho (a tax system, corvee) and in the regions, at first, each gun (county) had shoso for shozei (the rice tax stored in provincial offices warehouse) administered by gunji (district managers).

sen.j: やがて管理運用権が国司に移管され、多くが国府に移設された。
sen.e: Later, the right of the administration was transferred to kokushi (provincial governor) and lots of shoso were moved to kokufu (ancient provincial office/capital).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: Later, the right to manage and operate was transferred to kokushi (provincial governor) and lots of shoso were moved to kokufu (ancient provincial office/capital).
sen.cmt: of the administration→to manage and operate
sen.e: Later, the right to manage and operate was transferred to kokushi (provincial governor) and lots of shoso were moved to kokufu (ancient provincial office/capital).

sen.j: 形や収納物によって様々な種類がある。
sen.e: There are wide variations among shoso in terms of forms and stored materials.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: There are wide variations among shoso in terms of forms and stored materials.
There are wide variations among shoso in terms of forms and stored materials.

sen.j: 形状別では高倉・円倉・長倉（横倉）などに分けることができる。
sen.e: In terms of forms, shoso are categorized into takakura (high-positioned warehouse supported with four pillars), maru-kura, and naga-kura (yoko-kura).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: By forms, shoso are categorized into takakura (high-positioned warehouse supported with four pillars), maru-kura, and naga-kura (yoko-kura).
By forms, shoso are categorized into takakura (high-positioned warehouse supported with four pillars), maru-kura, and naga-kura (yoko-kura).

sen.j: 側壁の構造別では甲倉・各倉・板倉・丸木倉・土倉などに分けることができる。
sen.e: In terms of sidewall structures, shoso are categorized into yagura (literally armour storage), kaku-kura, ita-gura (warehouse whose walls are boards), and doso (underground warehouse).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: By sidewall structures, shoso are categorized into yagura (literally armour storage), kaku-kura, ita-gura (warehouse whose walls are boards), and doso (underground warehouse).
By sidewall structures, shoso are categorized into yagura (literally armour storage), kaku-kura, ita-gura (warehouse whose walls are boards), and doso (underground warehouse).

sen.j: 収納物別では不動穀倉・穎倉・粟倉・塩倉などに分けることができる。
sen.e: In terms of stored materials, shoso are categorized into fudokoku-so (grain reserves warehouse), eiso, awa-kura (millet warehouse), and en-so (salt warehouse).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処用語集では、不動穀倉=Fudo-kokuso (Fudo grain warehouse)となっていますが、不動穀=Fudokoku (staples for an emergency)となっているので、不動穀(非常時に備えて蓄えておく穀類）を保管している倉だと思います。http://ci.nii.ac.jp/naid/110002369240/では、不動穀をrice reservesとしています。したがって、不動穀倉=fudokoku-so (grain reserves warehouse)としました。
sen.e: By stored materials, shoso are categorized into fudokoku-so (grain reserves warehouse), eiso, awa-kura (millet warehouse), and en-so (salt warehouse).
By stored materials, shoso are categorized into fudokoku-so (grain reserves warehouse), eiso, awa-kura (millet warehouse), and en-so (salt warehouse).

sen.j: なお、側壁に用いた木材が倉の四隅で交差する構造をした倉を校倉（あぜくら）と呼称する。
sen.e: Moreover, the warehouse with the sidewall lumber crossing at the four corners, is called azekura.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処用語集では、校倉=Azekura (warehouse whose sides are made by placing logs across each other)となっていますが、ここでは、「側壁に用いた木材が倉の四隅で交差する構造をした倉」と説明しているので、カッコ内は省略しました。
sen.e: Moreover, the warehouse with the sidewall lumber crossing at the four corners, is called azekura.
Moreover, the warehouse with the sidewall lumber crossing at the four corners, is called azekura.

sen.j: これは壁材の木材が三角形構造をした甲倉において良く用いられ、後世には両者が混同されて甲倉構造をした倉庫を特に校倉造（あぜくらづくり）と呼ぶようになった。
sen.e: This warehouse structure is often used for yagura whose lumber for wall material is triangle structure, and later days, azekura and yagura were mixed up and the yagura structure warehouse is especially called azekura-zukuri style.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: This warehouse structure is often used for yagura whose lumber for wall material is triangle structure, and later days, azekura and yagura were mixed up and the yagura structure warehouse is especially called azekura-zukuri style.

This warehouse structure is often used for yagura whose lumber for wall material is triangle structure, and later days, azekura and yagura were mixed up and the yagura structure warehouse is especially called azekura-zukuri style.

sen.j: 大規模な正倉になると、一定の区画に複数の正倉が築かれて塀などで囲まれた区域が置かれることがあった。
sen.e: In the large-scale shoso, multiple shoso were built in the section surrounded by walls.
In the large-scale shoso, multiple shoso were built in the section surrounded by walls.
In the large-scale shoso, multiple shoso were built in the section surrounded by walls.

sen.j: これを正倉院（しょうそういん）と呼ぶ。
sen.e: This is called shosoin.
This is called shosoin.
This is called shosoin.

sen.j: 東大寺の正倉院も元々は数棟の校倉から成っていた（最大の校倉1棟が正倉院宝庫として現存している）。
sen.e: Shosoin in Todai-ji Temple was originally composed of several azekura (the biggest azekura still exists as Shoso-in Treasure House.)
Shosoin in Todai-ji Temple was originally composed of several azekura (the biggest azekura still exists as Shoso-in Treasure House.)
Shosoin in Todai-ji Temple was originally composed of several azekura (the biggest azekura still exists as Shoso-in Treasure House.)
